title: ‘Dangerous Cities,’ the Military, Trump and the Founding Fathers
summary: The U.S. armed services have long sought to preserve the tradition of a nonpartisan military.

summary: A Supreme Court order keeping Lisa Cook on the Federal Reserve Board for now is “a time to exhale but not breathe easy,” one expert said.

summary: Demands sent to nine top schools included pledging to freeze tuition for five years and to commit to strict definitions of gender.

summary: The Trump administration forged ahead with plans to conduct mass layoffs, as the fiscal standoff appeared to intensify.

summary: President Trump has made lowering health care costs a key priority, even as Democrats warn that costs will skyrocket.

summary: Unlike in shutdowns past, President Trump is the wild card.

summary: Two people were killed and at least three others were in serious condition after the vehicle ramming and stabbing attack on Yom Kippur.

summary: A new Times/Siena survey shows a significant shift among voters, as their concerns about the health of the political system overtake other issues.

title: In ‘Roofman,’ Channing Tatum Finally Feels He Can Hold His Own
summary: For years, he battled impostor syndrome: “I felt like I was just barely hanging on.” Finally, with “Roofman,” he says he can hold his own against any actor.

summary: A member of the Latter-day Saints church was worried about the road to recovery that the family of the Michigan gunman faced. So he started a donation page for them.

summary: Interviews in Gaza suggest wide support for a proposal that calls for an immediate end to a war that has brought immense civilian suffering.

summary: The Israeli government said it had detained activists onboard boats trying to take humanitarian goods to the enclave.
